results.title: Mum and dad
results.creator_credit: Patty Donaczy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Patty Donaczy’s parents got married in Cootamundra and made news. Despite being an interracial couple, they overlooked the prejudices of the time and embraced a future together. Their memory will live on in their children and grandchildren.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patty Donaczy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Little Dolly : Shakira
results.creator_credit: Daniel Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daniel Edwards’ little girl, Shakira, was born with Miller-Dieker syndrome, a congenital disorder. Edwards pays tribute to his late daughter, who he affectionately refers to as ‘Little Dolly’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Great cod fisher woman
results.creator_credit: Ramptha Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ramptha Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.

results.title: Goanna
results.creator_credit: Anna Williams, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Anna Williams’ story is ultimately about empowerment through music. Her uncle, Harry Williams, was a famous Indigenous country musician. Anna tells his story and how his influence and inspiration has helped to empower and heal Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Williams, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2007)
results.creator_credit: Sue Silk, Sonya Waters, Sally McCutcheon, Martin Zerfas, Lyn McLeavy, Louise Blake, Llywellyn Staiff, Joyce Evans, Edwin Whiting, Christine Lamb, Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eleven stories from members of the general public. Mostly autobiographical, they are stories that concern themselves mostly with the passions of the creator, whether social issues, history, hobbies or family. These passions and interests are what makes the participants who they are.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Silk, Sonya Waters, Sally McCutcheon, Martin Zerfas, Lyn McLeavy, Louise Blake, Llywellyn Staiff, Joyce Evans, Edwin Whiting, Christine Lamb, Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Why plant millions of trees
results.creator_credit: Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alfred Zerfas gives background to and outlines the achievements of Social Education and Development Society (SEDS). This organisation was started in the 1980s in response to the crushing effects of drought in Southern India. With persistance over the decades, the work of SEDS, in collaboration with the communities they support, has brought about economic, social and enviromental change in these communities with lasting benefits.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Alfred Zerfas gives background to and outlines the achievements of Social Education and Development Society (SEDS). This organisation was started in the 1980s in response to the crushing effects of drought in Southern India. With persistance over the decades, the work of SEDS, in collaboration with the communities they support, has brought about economic, social and enviromental change in these communities with lasting benefits.

results.brief_description: Flora, fauna and bushland is what makes Maroondah and Australia different to anywhere else in the world. The agenda of Llywellyn and her colleagues is to protect what’s left.

results.title: Unwise and foolish creations of fancy
results.creator_credit: Sally McCutcheon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sally McCutcheon tells her story, threaded together by her two life-long passions, dancing and beading. Through determination, discipline and the support of her family, McCutcheon has managed to excel at both at different stages of her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally McCutcheon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
